titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Howard of Escrick Papers
titlestmt.author: by Hugh Kennedy

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday January 22, 2019 at 06:54

did.unittitle: Howard of Escrick papers

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The papers contain correspondence and documents pertaining to Charles I's expedition to Scotland in 1640 and 1641, including transcripts of letters from John Pym, John Hampden, and the Committees of Parliamentary Instructions and Ordinances.

origination.label: creator
origination.persname: Howard of Escrick, Edward Howard, Baron, -1675

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Howard of Escrick Papers are the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Howard of Escrick Papers. James Marshall and Marie-Louise Osborn Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These papers represent an important collection of source materials surrounding Charles I's expedition to Scotland in 1640 and 1641. Edward Howard, though he originally agreed with the King's decision, was also one of the twelve dissenting peers who signed a petition on 28 August 1640 outlining the popular grievances and dangers attendant on the expedition.

The Howard of Escrick Papers are organized into three chronologically arranged series. Series I, Committee Correspondence
includes transcripts of relevant letters from Pym, Hampden, Fiennes, Lord Howard, and the Committees of Parliamentary instructions and ordinances, and letters to Lord Mandeville, Vane, Pym, the Speaker, the Earl of Essex, Hollis, Lord Holland, and others, all concerning the expedition and the reaction among Howard's contemporaries.

Items in Series II, Documents
section include a "Sedule contayning the particular sums of the Scotch losses & charges 7 Jan. 1640 (1)," the "Scotch com[missione]rs charge against the Earle of Strafford Dec. 16 1640" and "Instruccons of the Lordes and comons in Parliam[en]t to the Committees of both houses now attending his Royal Ma[jes]t[y] in Scotland." Included in Series III, Letters Cataloged Separately
are an autograph letter from Thomas Barrington to Lord Howard, assuring Howard of the country's support of Parliament, and two ALSs from Edward Littleton on the correspondence of a committee appointed by the House of Lords.

controlaccess.persname: Howard of Escrick, Edward Howard, Baron, -1675

did.unittitle: Committee Correspondence
Armyne, Stapelton, and Hampden to the Speaker Wm. Lenthall, Stilton

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1 p., 31 x 20 cm
Scots have disbanded part of their
army; some mutiny in Lord Carre's
regiment. Also written to Earl of
Essex by Lord Howard.

did.unittitle: Armyne, Stapelton, and Hampden to John Pym; Stilton

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1 p., 31 x 20 cm
Second letter of this day to Pym;
relays news that Earl of Traquair
was beheaded in effigy and that
Earl of Montrose was removed to a
stricter prison.

did.unittitle: Fiennes to the Speaker Lenthall, 8 pm, York

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
2 p., 30 x 20 cm.
Concerning payment and disbanding
of troops; need for money; shipment
of ordnance from Berwick to London.
Also written to Earl of Essex with
slight alteration.

did.unittitle: Fiennes, Armyne, Stapelton, and Hampden to Denzil Holles; York

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
2 p., 31 x 20 cm
Requests L 36,000 to disband the
cavalry, more to disband foot
soldiers, monies to be collected
from nine counties in proportion to
subsidy; Scots disbanded army
despite Earl of Argyll's opposition
in Parliament.

did.unittitle: Lord Howard to Earl of Essex; Darlington

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1 p., 30 x 21 cm
Refers problem of gaining commission
by King's great seal back to
Parliament; apologizes for any
discrepancy between his letter and
a Mr. Nicolls'.
Also written by Committee to the
Speaker.

did.unittitle: All the Committee to the Earl of Holland; Edinburgh

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1 p., 31 x 21 cm
Profuse thanks for a favor; reports
having met Lord Maitland on the road
with orders from Parliament for
Earl of Holland to disband his
English Army.

did.unittitle: Lord Howard to Earl of Essex; Edinburgh

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
2 p., 31 x 21 cm
Reports Lord Maitland is on way with
directions for disbanding Army. Scots
have ratified the treaty and will do
so under Great Seal to satisfy
Parliament of England. Scots still
have 5000 foot and 500 horse.

did.unittitle: Fiennes, Armyne, Stapelton, and Hampden to Pym; Edinburgh

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
2 p., 31 x 20 cm
Worries over lack of correspondence
from London, of directions for their
mission, and of Parliamentary recess.
Without commission under Great Seal
can only act as conduit to Parliament
of England.

did.unittitle: Fiennes, Armyne, Stapelton, and Hampden to Speaker Lenthall; Edinburgh

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1 p., 31 x 20 cm
On behalf of Sir Michael Ernely,
officer in garrison at Berwick,
requests one month's pay for the
troops (L 3000), and presents John
Conyer's petition for employment.

did.unittitle: All the Committee to the Earl of Essex; Edinburgh

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
3 p., 30 x 21 cm
Scots refuse to disband until English
do; if made to wait, many want
recompense; previous account of E. of
Traquair proves false.

did.unittitle: Fiennes, Armyne, Stapelton, and Hampden to Pym; Edinburgh

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
2 p., 30 x 20 cm
Requests more specific information on
money to pay off army and garrison to
satisfy Scots. Urges appropriation of
the whole sum.

did.unittitle: Fiennes, Armyne, Stapelton, and Hampden to Speaker Leuthall; Edinburgh

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1 p., 30 x 20
King received letter from Spanish
ambassador re: 4000 soldiers.
Charles I approved their release from
army in Ireland in accord with
Parliament.

did.unittitle: All the Committee to Earl of Holland; Edinburgh

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
2 p., 31 x 20 cm
From Lord Grandison heard that
although cavalry is disbanded and
foot soldiers will be by the 18th,
money for the garrisons not certain;
Edinburgh promises to pay
Scots to adhere to treaty when
appropriate.

did.unittitle: Lord Howard to Lord Keeper Littleton; Edinburgh

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
2 p., 31 x 20 cm
Reports having told Charles I of
Spanish request for 4,000 men; seeks
money for garrisons of Berwick and
Carlisle; Scots will not disband
their armies until two garrisons
are discharged. This letter also
written to Pym by the Committee.

did.unittitle: All the Committee to Earl of Holland; Edinburgh

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1 p., 31 x 20 cm
Acknowledges Parliament's command to
disband the army and the artillery;
Scots will likewise disband and
withdraw regiments facing the
garrisons of Berwick and Carlisle.
Hopes for perfect peace.

did.unittitle: All the Committee to Mr. Treasurer Vane; Edinburgh

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
2 p., 31 x 20 cm
Yesterday King delivered to Parliament
list of councillors minus bishops,
papists, and prisoners, but including
Lords Lindsay, Loudon, Dunfermline.

did.unittitle: Lord Howard, Stapelton, and Hampden to Pym; Edinburgh

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

did.unittitle: All the Committee to Mr. Maxwell; Edinburgh

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1 p., 31 x 20 cm
Thanks for his friend's generous
accommodations.

did.unittitle: Lord Howard to Lord Keeper Littleton; Edinburgh

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1 p., 31 x 20 cm
Reports meeting with Committee of
the Army over discharge of garrisons;
Scots regiment at Aberdeen to be
disbanded presently, others when
English garrisons are. Also sent to
Mr. Pym from the rest of the
Committee.

did.unittitle: All the Committee to unidentified Commissioner of the Treasury; Edinburgh

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
2p., 31 x 20 cm
L 8,000 for Berwick is insufficient,
ships needed for transport of
munitions; Lord Mourtons's removal
from list of Councillors delays King's
return, which Committee wishes to
hasten.

did.unittitle: Lord Howard to Lord Keeper Littleton; Edinburgh

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1 p., 29 x 20 cm
King's departure likely to be delayed
one month; wishes to leave to return
to England sooner, his charge
being completed.

did.unittitle: Fiennes, Armyne, Stapelton, and Hampden to Pym; Edinburgh

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
2 p., 31 x 30 cm
Regarding the fortifications of
Berwick, destruction or restoration?
King's departure delayed by selection
of officers and councillors. Seeks
leave to return for Parliament ahead
of King.

did.unittitle: All the Committee to Lord Mandeville; Edinburgh

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
2 p., 31 x 20 cm
Jealousies and suspicions that they
must remain in Scotland to the benefit
of some faction, fear of ill weather,
desire to be at Parliament; requests
leave to return, charges being done.

did.unittitle: All the Committee to Michael Ernely; Edinburgh

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1 p., 31 x 20 cm
L 18,000 for the garrison at Berwick
on its way; L 18,000 (11,000?) to
follow. Authority to slight the outer
works of the town; if orders for
Committee are sent to Berwick, send
them on.

did.unittitle: All the Committee to Court of the Bishoprick of Durham; Edinburgh

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1 p., 31 x 20 cm
Invitation by Lord General and
Officers of Scots Army to perform
some act of justice between
Soldiers and Landlords where they
billeted. Relations between them
mentioned.

did.unittitle: All the Committee to Michael Ernely; Edinburgh

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
2 p., 31 x 20 cm
Enclosure wanting.
Returning arms of Townsmen seized;
needs warrant to keep the arms and
munitions at Berwick.

did.unittitle: All the Committee to Michael Ernely; Edinburgh

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1 p., 30 x 20 cm
Declining to oversee the matters
at Berwick, leaving them instead
to Michael Ernely.

did.unittitle: All the Committee to Pym; Edinburgh

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1 p., 29 x 20 cm
Gratitude for letters and intimation
that orders for their return are
being sent.

did.unittitle: Fiennes, Armyne, Stapelton, and Hampden to Pym; Edinburgh

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1 p., 29 x 20 cm
Evidently has been made Lt. Gov.
of Berwick; recommends title not
be taken away; will not have
been to Berwick.

did.unittitle: Lord Howard to Lord Keeper Littleton; Edinburgh

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
2 p., 29 x 20 cm
News of plot to seize Marquess
Hamilton, Earl of Argyle and Earl
of Lanericke, also of depositions
in Parliament by a Captain Stewart.

did.unittitle: All the Committee to Michael Ernely; Edinburgh

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1 p., 29 x 19 cm
Acknowledges information of King's
command to disbanding the remainder
of the garrison; will send more on
question of removing the drawbridge
and gates.

did.unittitle: All the Committee to Pym; Edinburgh

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
The garrison is now disbanded; the
Scots have withdrawn to the city.
Due to differences over examination
of Marquess Hamilton and Earl of
Argyle nothing has been done.

did.unittitle: All the Committee to William Carnaby; Edinburgh

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
2 p., 29 x 20 cm
As Ernely has already begun slighting
the works at Berwick, does not plan
to visit; question of drawbridge,
inner works. Works near Sir James
Douglas' to be slighted as well.

did.unittitle: Documents
DS; Adam Blair; no place

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
7 p., 31 x 20 cm
Scottish committee charges against
E. of Strafford.

did.unittitle: DS; Adam Blair; no place

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
7 p., 31 x 20 cm
Schedule containing particular
sums of Scottish losses and charges.

did.unittitle: Document; no place

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
2 p., 30 x 20 cm
Acquittals of John, Earl of Traquair
and James, E. of Montrose.

did.unittitle: Document; no place

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1 p., 29 x 19 cm
Appt. of Committee -- E. of Bedford,
Lord Howard, Armine, Stapelton,
et. al. and their duties.

did.unittitle: Document; no place

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1 p., 29 x 19 cm
Petition to Charles I to accept
Lord Howard et. al. as Commissioners
to act as intermediates between King
and Parliament.

did.unittitle: DS; William Lenthall and Edward Littleton; no place

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
2 p., 29 x 19 cm
Ordinance of Parliament with
instructions to the Committee.

did.unittitle: DS; E. of Holland to Viscount Grandison; no place

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
2 p., 30 x 20 cm
Instructions...to be observed by him
in his present journey into Scotland.

did.unittitle: DS; John Browne; no place

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
4 p., 30 x 19 cm
Instructions to the Committee of
both Houses now in Edinburgh.

did.unittitle: DS; John Browne and Henry Elsynge; no place

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
5 p., 30 x 19 cm
Instructions to be sent to the
Committee of both houses now
attending his majesty at Edinburgh.

did.unittitle: DS; John Browne; no place

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
2 p., 30 x 19 cm
Concerning the raising and
transporting forces of horses
and soldiers.

did.unittitle: DS; John Browne and Henry Elsynge

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
2 p., 30 x 19 cm
Concerning raising and transporting
forces of horses and foot out of his
Majesty's kingdom.

did.unittitle: Document; no place

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
2 p., 30 x 20 cm
King to nominate officers and
councillors subject to Scottish
Parliament's opposition.

did.unittitle: Document; no place

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1 p., 30 x 20 cm
Also concerning King's nomination of
Scots officers and councillors.
Suggests recess for the Commission
of the Council.

did.unittitle: Document; no place

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
2 p., 30 x 20 cm
Answers to doubts proposed by King
on election of officers, etc.

did.unittitle: Document; no place

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
2 p., 29 x 19 cm
Unlabelled orders 1-7: Commission
for ordering Treasury be drawn up,
Agenda of Scottish Parliament(?).

did.unittitle: Document; no place

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1 p., 18 x 20 cm
King's message to Parliament,
refusal to grant commission,
disbanding of Army.

did.unittitle: Document; no place

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1 p., 15 x 20 cm fragment
Will welcome any members of English
Parliament to be present at Scottish
Parliament's ratification of the
treaty.

did.unittitle: Document; no place

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Summaries of King's request of
Committee (?) to write to Berwick,
to not write to Parliament, to write
Lord Keeper regarding week by week
adjournment.

did.unittitle: Document; no place

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1 p., 30 x 20 cm
Committee's response to King's
request: to wait for word from
Parliament on slowly disbanding
garrison, to report to Parliament,
to let Parliament decide
adjournments.

did.unittitle: DS; Jo[hn] Throckmorton DCP; no place

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1 p., 30 x 19 cm
Commanding Lord Howard's return, as
requested in his last letter.

did.unittitle: DS; Jo[hn] Throckmorton DCP; no place

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1 p., 22 x 19 cm
Note to Committee -- high burgesses,
several burgesses and assistants.

did.unittitle: DS; Jo[hn] Throckmorton DCP; no place

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
2 p., 29 x 19 cm
Provisions for public safety due to
disbanding of the army.

did.unittitle: Document; no place

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
2 p., 29 x 19 cm
Captain William Stewart's
deposition on the E. of Crawford's
plot against Marquesses Hamilton
and Argyle.

did.unittitle: Document; no place

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
2 p., 29 x 19 cm
Opposition to public trial of a
recent incident.

did.unittitle: Document; no place

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
2 p., 29 x 18 cm
A Sillogism for the Private
Committee: advocates private Committee
for examination of secret plots before
examination in Parliament.

did.unittitle: Document; no place

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
3 p., 29 x 19 cm
Declaration of Parliament against
this new plot.

did.unittitle: Document; no place

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
3 p., 30 x 19 cm
Instructions from Parliament to the
Committee of both Houses attending
Charles I: on E. of Crawford's
plot, treaty with Scotland, disbanding
of garrisons at Carlisle and Berwick.

did.unittitle: Letters Catalogued Separately
BARRINGTON, SIR THOMAS, BART., C. 1589-1644
ALS to Lord Howard; Hatfield Broadoaks, Essex

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
3 p., 32 x 21 cm, with address
Mentions difficulties in executing
ordinances for disarming papists and
collecting Poll-money. Assures
Ld. Howard of country's support
of Parliament.

did.unittitle: LITTLETON, EDWARD LITTLETON, 1ST BARON, 1589-1645
2 ALS (one signed) to [Lord Howard]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
2 p., 29 x 18 cm, 20 x 14 cm
Regarding letters to and replies from
committee appointed by House of Peers.
